AVSEC Order No.  18 /2011 
  
Sub: Strengthening of security towards city side of airports  
 
        In exercise of powers conferred by Section 5A of Aircraft Act, 1934, delegated 
to him vide Government of India, Ministry of Civil Aviation Notification No. 1797 dated 
July 3, 1997, for the purpose of securing the aircraft operations and strengthening the 
security arrangements at the civil airports in India, the Commissioner of Security (CA) 
directs that the following security measures shall be taken by concerned agencies with 
immediate effect for tightening the security towards city side of the airport:  
 
i) Photographs of the drivers and registration number of vehicles shall be recorded; 
ii) CCTV cameras in vehicle parking areas shall be installed immediately and 
parking lots shall be guarded by CISF/ASG and APSU; 
iii) Parking area should be 100m away from terminal building wherever airport outlay 
so allows;  
iv) No temporary Airport Pass shall be issued without  photograph; 
v) Visitors shall not be allowed to carry baggage in Arrival and Departure area; if at 
all ladies carry any baggage or purse, these shall be physically inspected; 
vi) Separate entry tickets shall be issued for Departure or Arrival Halls, wherever 
there are separate enclosures; 
vii) Equipments mentioned in circular nos. 2/2007, 14/2010, 18/2010 and 20/2010 
shall be installed immediately. 
 
Any violation of this AVSEC Order shall attract penalty under Section 11A of the Aircraft 
Act, 1934. 
 
 
(Gurjot Singh Malhi, IPS) 
Commissioner of Security  (CA )
